relation: Joe Smith starts the inning for the Indians.
Brayan Pena singled to left. Runner on first with none out and Ramon Santiago due up.
Ramon Santiago lined into a double play, second to first. On the play, Brayan Pena out at first. None on with two out and Andy Dirks due up.
Andy Dirks walked. Runner on first with two out and Austin Jackson due up.
Austin Jackson struck out swinging to end the inning.
pageTitle: Wednesday, August 7, 2013 Detroit Tigers - Cleveland Indians Box Scores, Game Results & Summary - USATODAY.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {49495=Jeremy Bonderman (2-3) spun three scoreless innings of one-hit ball in relief to notch the victory, his first as a Tiger since Sept. 8, 2010. Joaquin Benoit secured his 14th save of the season, despite giving up a run in the bottom of the 14th., 49957=Miguel Cabrera clubbed a two-run homer and Jackson added a solo shot for the Tigers, who are riding their longest winning streak since a 12-game spurt from Sept. 2-14, 2011.}
